alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 8:27PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...AN UNSETTLED PATTERN EXPECTED FOR THE MARIANAS THROUGH CHRISTMAS WEEKEND... A developing wet pattern is expected to affect the Marianas over the next several days, including Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. A weak circulation, Invest 94W, located southeast of Eauripik near 2.5N 142E, is expected to move northward toward the Marianas as a shear line drifts south toward the CNMI. These two systems will interact to bring increasing convection to the region for the end of the week into next week, including Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. Latest model guidance varies greatly on expected rainfall, however, they do agree that the region will see a wet and unsettled pattern into next week. The current forecast calls for showers to peak across the region on Friday into Christmas Eve, then slowly diminish through early next week. Rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches, with locally heavier amounts, are possible. This is not expected to pose a flooding threat at this time, however, this could change depending on how the systems develop over the next couple of days. If confidence in the potential for flooding increases by Wednesday, an Hydrologic Outlook may be needed. Gusty winds will continue through Wednesday night, then are expected to decrease a bit for the remainder of the week. As Invest 94W approaches the Marianas, gusty winds become a possibility again. Folks in the Marianas should keep up-to-date with the latest statements and advisories from the National Weather Service and your local emergency management offices. Forecast products issued by the National Weather Service are posted on the WFO Guam web page at www.weather.gov/gum.
